name: MistralAIModel

input.content:
In freecad I want to have a circle but only for reference not to actually be a circle but just so I can line up other lines to make a hexagon for example.
How do I do that?

output:
In FreeCAD, you can use a construction geometry layer to create reference shapes that won't be part of the final geometry. Here's how you can create a reference circle to help you draw a hexagon:

1. Switch to the Draft Workbench if you're not already in it. You can do this by clicking on "Draft" in the workbench menu.

2. Create a new construction geometry layer:
   - Click on the "Layers" icon in the toolbar or go to View -> Panels -> Layers to open the Layers panel.
   - Click on the "+" button at the bottom of the Layers panel to create a new layer.
   - Double-click on the new layer's name and rename it to something like "Construction".
   - Make sure the "Construction" layer is selected, then click on the "Toggle construction" icon (looks like a gear) in the Layers panel to set it as a construction layer.

3. Now, you can create a reference circle:
   - Click on the "Circle" tool in the Draft toolbar or go to Draft -> Circle.
   - You'll be prompted to select a center point and a radius for your circle. Choose appropriate values based on your design.
   - Once the circle is created, it will appear as a dashed line, indicating that it's a construction geometry.

4. Use the reference circle to draw your hexagon using the Draft Line tool:
   - Click on the "Line" tool in the Draft toolbar or go to Draft -> Line.
   - Use the circle as a guide to create the vertices of the hexagon by clicking at the desired points along the circle's circumference.
   - After drawing each line segment, the line tool will remain active, allowing you to continue drawing additional segments.
   - Once you've drawn all six sides of the hexagon, right-click or press Esc to exit the Line tool.

5. If you want to hide the reference circle, you can do so in the Layers panel:
   - Click on the "Layers" icon in the toolbar to open the Layers panel if it's not already open.
   - Click on the eye icon next to the "Construction" layer to hide it, which will also hide the reference circle.

By following these steps, you can use a reference circle to create a hexagon or any other shape you need in FreeCAD. The construction geometry layer allows you to keep your reference shapes separate from your final geometry.
